column4: Can anyone tell me how to allocate more space for persistent files on my Live USB?
Using 9.10, AMD 64
I've made a couple changes I'd not much like to lose; isn't there a command line to just add more space to the persistent account?
I opened it in GParted; there was only one partition and it was roughly half full
just backup, reinstall on the USB, and then restore..
can you back up without backing up partition size, too?
of course.  backing up /home should be good enough to save your settings..
I've done it on an 8gb flash disk..  are you giving the disk persistent storage space?

Doing so from Jaunty creates the disk, but fails to make it persistent. And yes, I tried giving it the entire drive. It never asks me how much to use on Karmic, because it can't find a partition it considers acceptable.
it is formated as fat32?
When I format it as fat32, it is recognized, but it says it requires formatting. Telling it to proceed with the format causes it to drop the partition and remove the drive from the list.
that is normal.  it should unmount it to format it, and then continue with the install.
To clarify, any formatting must be done with GParted; having usb-creator do it causes the partition to be dropped and the drive removed from its list
hmm, that is odd.  I don't know why it would do that..  You could always do it manually...
Do which part manually? USB disk creation or formatting?
the USB disk creation.  there is a how to on google somewhere i'll see if I can find it..
also, it has ceased to remove it from the list; now it just formats it in a manner that is not to its liking and leaves the warning sign next to it
the tut i saw was not architecture dependant.  basically just copying files..
sorry, im still looking...
I'm going to give portablelinux a shot
FYI portable linux did not work for me, but try it.  Here is that link http://www.debuntu.org/how-to-install-ubuntu-linux-on-usb-bar
